issues.description: In the problem statement’s description of the `PersonController`, the bullet lists “Each method takes a Consumer<List<Note>> parameter,” but the controller methods actually use Consumer<List<Person>>. This copy-paste error in the problem text could confuse students about the correct generic type to use.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the problem statement bullet to refer to Consumer<List<Person>> rather than Consumer<List<Note>> when describing methods of PersonController.

issues.description: The problem statement (line 150) incorrectly refers to methods taking a Consumer<List<Note>> for the PersonController, while both the template and solution PersonController signatures use Consumer<List<Person>>. This discrepancy can confuse students about the expected parameter type.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the problem statement to refer to Consumer<List<Person>> instead of Consumer<List<Note>> for PersonController methods so that it matches the template and solution code.
